thread.title: GoFundMe Set Up For Canyon Country Man Killed By Drunk Driver
thread.title_full: GoFundMe Set Up For Canyon Country Man Killed By Drunk Driver

author: Andrew Menjivar
title: GoFundMe Set Up For Canyon Country Man Killed By Drunk Driver
text: A [GoFundMe](https://gofund.me/45172cb3) has been set up for a Canyon Country man who was killed after being fatally struck by a drunk driver last week. A GoFundMe has been set up for Eddie Meadows, 53, a Santa Clarita native, son, father and uncle, who was killed after being [fatally struck by a DUI driver](https://www.hometownstation.com/santa-clarita-news/crime/canyon-country-man-fatally-struck-by-presumed-drunk-driver-491771) on Sierra Highway near Sand Canyon on Dec. 21. “Our family is heartbroken and (has) many unanswered questions as to why this had to happen in such a tragic way.” said the GoFundMe. “There were no goodbyes, prayers, hugs or a chance to tell him that we loved him. His life was unexpectedly taken from him.” On Dec. 21, California Highway Patrol (CHP) received reports of a traffic collision involving a pedestrian on Sierra Highway. At approximately 6:10 p.m., Meadows was pronounced deceased at the scene, said Officer Josh Greengard, spokesperson for the California Highway Patrol Newhall Area Office. During the investigation, it was determined the driver of the Silverado was under the influence at the time of the collision, according to Greengard. Hector Castillo, 38, from Newhall, was arrested for felony DUI, according to Greengard. As of Thursday, $960 of the $8,000 goal has been raised. To donate to the GoFundMe, [click here](https://gofund.me/45172cb3). Sponsored Articles Do you have a news tip? Call us at (661) 298-1220, or send an email to news@hometownstation.com. Report a typo or error, email Corrections@hometownstation.com KHTS FM 98.1 and AM 1220 is Santa Clarita’s only local radio station. KHTS mixes in a combination of news, traffic, sports, and features along with your favorite adult contemporary hits. Santa Clarita news and features are delivered throughout the day over our airwaves, on our website and through a variety of social media platforms. Our KHTS national award-winning daily news briefs are now read daily by 34,000+ residents. A vibrant member of the Santa Clarita community, the KHTS broadcast signal reaches all of the Santa Clarita Valley and parts of the high desert communities located in the Antelope Valley.
